DataElement.preferredName: CHAMPS Activities Questionnaire for Older Adults 39.1 During Past 4 Weeks Do General Conditioning Exercises Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's numerical response of how many times a week they did general conditioning exercises, such as light calisthenics or chair exercises, during the past 4 weeks.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: CHAMPS Activities Questionnaire for Older Adults During Past 4 Weeks Do General Conditioning Exercises
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-report physical activity questionnaire for older men and women, developed to evaluate the outcomes of the Community Healthy Activities Model Program for Seniors (CHAMPS), an intervention to increase physical activity._At some point in a given period of time._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about whether an individual did general conditioning exercises, like  light calisthenics or chair exercises.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: CHAMPS Activities Questionnaire for Older Adults
